name: Landfall House Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed three nights at Landfall House in Kinsale and had a wonderful time. Margo and Donie are fantastic hosts and made our stay very enjoyable. We truly felt like we were welcome guests in their home. The house is away from the city center, which makes for quiet nights and great sleeping. Margo showed where we could park for free in town. Our room was clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were great. With Donie providing the entertainment our days always started out on the right note. A couple of reviewers have mentioned a problem with the wifi connection. I experienced a problem, too, but Margo took the time to check it out and I was able to get connected with her help. We were totally satisfied with our stay and would definitely stay at Landfall House again if we return to Kinsale.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Kinsale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed here with my girlfriend whilst on a 3-day trip to Cork. We found the place with ease and were literally delighted when we arrived. Rooms were clean and spacious with great amenities. The breakfast the following morning was smashing and the chat from both the host & hostess was excellent, definitely worth the trip down.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B with authentic charm and a beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd a lovely time in Kinsale and I would recommend a visit to Landfall House B&B to anyone!!
reviews.title: Quiet, clean room with great views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for our second night in Kinsale, Ireland, at this lovely, clean B&B with fantastic views from our bedroom window. Donie, our host, was a delightful man with a great sense of humor (and very "Irish"), who greeted us when we came in. After we settled in, he kindly gave us a ride back into town, after we had gotten somewhat lost navigating our car, to Landfall. He pointed to navigational highlights along the way, while giving humorous antidotes about local attractions, so it was easy to walk back following our dinner. The breakfast the next morning was very nice, prepared and served by Donie and his wife, Margo, who also was also outgoing and helpful about local sites and highlights along the route we would be taking to our next destination. We highly recommend this B&B, if you don't mind being a little out of town, away from the hub-bub of busy, downtown Kinsale.
reviews.title: Warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Landfall house as part of our 5 day trip to Ireland. We were greeted warmly and enthusiastically by Donie. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable. Our friends had a lovely view but our room made up for the lack of view with it's size. Margo was also very friendly and Donie is a larger than life character.Donie reccomended several places to eat in in Kinsale and gave us good information on places to visit the next day. donie was also kind enough to give us a lift into Kinsale too.We were travelling on motor bikes and the drive is a bit steep with gravel, causing us a bit of worry! A very comfortable stay and we would reccomend.
reviews.title: Look no further

reviews.text: We have never felt so welcome! Charming hosts, clean lovely home with spectacular views and superb food. @BentlyBoy - I couldn't disagree with your posting more! This was just a wonderful experience...can't imagine it being anything else for any one of the other guests. Wouldn't have changed a thing.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheers Donny and Margo!
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.text: We stayed at Landfall House one night in June of 2013. Margo and Donny are lovely hosts that make you feel relaxed in their beautiful home. The rooms in back of the house have an amazing view overlooking Kinsale and the water. The 2 rooms in the front have less of a view but are incredibly spacious and can accommodate more than 2 people. The house is clean, updated and light-filled. The breakfasts are great. Margo gives you a choice, which was a nice break for several mornings of full Irish breakfasts (although that is an option as well).
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Kinsale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon leaving Kinsale and Landfall, we discovered we had a flat tire. We returned to Landfall and since it was a Sunday had few options for repairs. Margo looked up the car manual for us, since this was not in the rental. Donny assisted my husband for an hour on the tire. This was a busy time of day, as a full house was leaving and another full house was checking in shortly. They were kind, gracious and incredibly helpful. They sent us on our way with several items to help with the next day of travel. We cannot say enough about our amazing experience at Landfall and are eager to come back and visit Kinsale and Landfall House.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave!

reviews.text: Landfall is a beautiful house in a great location, just a 15-20 minute walk from the town centre. But, I have to warn you, it is uphill on the way back, so be ready for it. The room I had was large and modern with a beautiful view of the bay. Everything was super clean and very comfortable. Margo and Donny are excellent hosts with great recommendations for things to do, where to eat, and places to visit. As other reviewers have noted, Donny is a character and makes breakfast really entertaining. I had a wonderful visit.
reviews.title: Great place and wonderful hosts!

reviews.text: We stayed at Landfall in July 2013.
reviews.title: Landfall B&B, Kinsale, Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Margo and Donie, hostess and host were EXCEPTIONAL!!!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also could pass as entertainers. They both were extremely friendlly and were an absoulte "hoot" to be around, as well as answering all our queries about the town itself and surrounding sites. (Gave us great tips on local restaurants).
reviews.title: Great Experience at Landfall House!
Fun in the Sun!
reviews.text: We felt as if we were staying with old friends who had invited us for a weekend stay.
The house, and views of the Branon River and Atlantic ocean in the background were stunning.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a highly booked B&B due to the fact many B&B's closer to town are Way overpriced (like the Presbetery- which is usually booked solid) so.... you have to ask yourself: do you really WANT to be That close to the downtown Square? This facility location is perfect. Having stayed at 11 First Rate B&B's in the last 15 days on this trip, I really expected more from this one, at this price. Their own website quotes: "70-90 euro" cash for two beds, which I thought strange (must be about the location of your room ) but, I booked it anyhow.
reviews.title: Come See...Come Saw

reviews.text: I should skip ahead here to mention, on departure, I must have registered surprise to be charged more than 70 euro per night. Margo exclaimed "you booked it as the last minute" when in fact, I booked it over 18 days out. However, too tired/sick to argue, I succumbed.
reviews.title: WoW!!! Great place. Highly recommend!

reviews.text: Our room was at the back corner , 2nd story of the House and had a view of..... the other homes in the area with some kind of old, unfinished structure below. The wifi reception was lame- in/out, and the quilts and soiled carpet - WELL Used. The room was not 'crisp', but, large by Irish B&B Standards and the bathroom, looked regulation size. The shower door had been knocked off it's track and I couldn't fix it. Limp Biscuit over-used towels.
reviews.title: Nice but cramped

reviews.text: We had written Margo in the last week of May and inquired about "how long it took to drive from point A to point B, as we already heard the stories of how long it ACTUALLY took to drive the road system ( forget the aa roadwatch website, its useless). We then, discovered shortly into the trip- the Irish are VERY optimistic and must judge by their own 100kph driving habits, not the tourist driving kissing the curb, 'wrong side of the road, on the 'wrong' side of the car, shifting with your left hand instead of the right, and having your mirror knocked-off by a hit and run SUV :) I own a car dealership and graduated Skip Barbers Driving~ Racing School but, was blown away by how long... short distances took, and sometimes how difficult, it was to drive in Ireland. The roads are deplorable once you leave M8, or any superhighway, ( I destroyed 2 new low-profile radials on potholes, unseen, driving in pouring rain). So, at this point, leery of making our flight home on time, within an hour of checking in, I cancelled the 3rd night with Landfall house and quickly noticed a 'change of attitude' by Margo the next morning. I understand surviving in business but , sufficient notice was given.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.text: Donie IS the unquestionable success in of this operation. Given the least credit: He is a National Treasure and everyone else falls in 3rd-4th place. He was very understanding, humorous and helpful- just like the other reviewers mentioned ....also offering to take us to town so, we wouldn't get lost driving up or down the hill (after a couple of Guinness? ). He's the genuine Article (and in our eyes- he MAKES this operation). The breakfast's were very nice and the room acceptable but, value vs. value in our entire stay for 15 days- I would place this as a 'B -' until they freshen up room 4 . We stayed in MUCH nicer places all over the Southwest & Southern tip of Ireland, in some of the Top Cities, for less money. Yet, overall- very nice people and despite the moaning about location, written here by others- this B&B is really.... just around the corner from the heart of the action. Parking never an issue. So, in over 200 contributions registered with this website.......... I still give Landfall House a 'Very Good' rating and recommend them.
reviews.title: Beautiful home, most comfy bed, and lovely hosts... you won't be bored at breakfast!

description: Our unique location offers unrivalled views of the river Bandon, Kinsale Harbour and Atlantic ocean. A house of great elegance and charm, each room is tastefully decorated with your comfort in mind. Our exceptionally spacious rooms are all en suite with power showers, TV, tea and coffee facilities, hairdryers and radio alarm clocks. We offer an extensive breakfast menu.
